title: Walking Through Walls and Other Impossibilities: The Hybrid Agenda
features: The goal of the aliens among us is not the study of Earth for purely academic purposes. It is something more vital to the aliens and more portentous for us. The picture that emerges from much research makes sense of several aspects of the alien presence, previously quite puzzling. They apparently are a dying race inhabiting a dying planet. They have undoubtedly mastered physical forces and phenomena of which we have not even dreamed. But it has come at a terrible cost. Their emotional life has been all but lost, existing only as a faint remnant from a long distant past. They may pity our hopelessly primitive technology, but they envy us our robust emotional life. Like all living things everywhere they live for the perpetuation of their genes. They do not hate us, nor do they seek our destruction. They seek to create a race of hybrids, combining their scientifically superior minds with our rich emotional makeup. The ridicule of the entire subject by the government and other forces, fearful of upheaval in our society, has aggravated the suffering of those chosen and victimized by the aliens, who apparently seek, ineptly sometimes, to minimize it.  "The author combines this scholarly approach with an almost folksy narrative style to make

a very readable and approachable treatise on the phenomena... as good as any book on the subject and far more skillfully written than most, including those Brener has referenced most frequently, Bud Hopkins' Intruders and Philip Corso's The Day after Roswell." -Blue Ink Review
description: "He [Brener] is at his most persuasive with a scrutiny of the neglected radar evidence and titular testimony of aliens and their abductees able to pass through solid substances. This latter 'impossibility' is noteworthy...  it anticipates cutting-edge advances in teleportation and quantum 'entanglement' physics."

author: {'avatar': 'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41PJlR9eA8L._SY600_.jpg', 'name': 'Milton E. Brener', 'about': ['Milton Brener is a retired New Orleans trial lawyer. After retirement he returned to Tulane University and earned a master\'s degree in anthropology. He is the author of fifteen published books on various subjects, including cerebral asymmetry, the rise of humanism in Ancient Greece, operatic history, and the extraterrestrial scene. In connection with many of his books he has spoken on radio and television and participated in panel discussions. His latest book is "Mental Telepathy and Announcing Dreams," and includes the input of opinions and many experiences establishing the verity of telepathy. These include Upton Sinclair, Sigmund Freud, Carl Jung, William James, and may others dating back to the ancient Greeks. He suggests that an aspect of Quantum Mechanics, known as \'entanglement\', may be the scientific basis for this phenomenon. This is his fourth book dealing with entanglement and its possible existence as the basis for unusual phenomena reported through the centuries.']}
